defs.docs:
A Rust library for build scripts to automatically configure code based on
 compiler support.  Code snippets are dynamically tested to see if the `rustc`
 will accept them, rather than hard-coding specific version support.

attributes.value: / A Rust library for build scripts to automatically configure code based on
/ compiler support.  Code snippets are dynamically tested to see if the `rustc`
/ will accept them, rather than hard-coding specific version support.
/ ## Usage
/ Add this to your `Cargo.toml`:
/ ```toml
/ [build-dependencies]
/ autocfg = "0.1"
/ Then use it in your `build.rs` script to detect compiler features.  For
/ example, to test for 128-bit integer support, it might look like:
/ ```rust
/ extern crate autocfg;
/ fn main() {
/ #   // Normally, cargo will set `OUT_DIR` for build scripts.
/ #   std::env::set_var("OUT_DIR", "target");
/     let ac = autocfg::new();
/     ac.emit_has_type("i128");
/     // (optional) We don't need to rerun for anything external.
/     autocfg::rerun_path(file!());
/ If the type test succeeds, this will write a `cargo:rustc-cfg=has_i128` line
/ for Cargo, which translates to Rust arguments `--cfg has_i128`.  Then in the
/ rest of your Rust code, you can add `#[cfg(has_i128)]` conditions on code that
/ should only be used when the compiler supports it.
deny(missing_debug_implementations)
deny(missing_docs)
allow(unknown_lints)
allow(bare_trait_objects)
allow(ellipsis_inclusive_range_patterns)

defs.name: Error
defs.docs: A common error type for the `autocfg` crate.

attributes.value: / A common error type for the `autocfg` crate.

defs.name: AutoCfg
defs.docs: Helper to detect compiler features for `cfg` output in build scripts.

attributes.value: / Helper to detect compiler features for `cfg` output in build scripts.

defs.name: emit
defs.docs: Writes a config flag for rustc on standard out.

attributes.value: / Writes a config flag for rustc on standard out.
/ This looks like: `cargo:rustc-cfg=CFG`
/ Cargo will use this in arguments to rustc, like `--cfg CFG`.

defs.name: rerun_path
defs.docs: Writes a line telling Cargo to rerun the build script if `path` changes.

attributes.value: / Writes a line telling Cargo to rerun the build script if `path` changes.
/ This looks like: `cargo:rerun-if-changed=PATH`
/ This requires at least cargo 0.7.0, corresponding to rustc 1.6.0.  Earlier
/ versions of cargo will simply ignore the directive.

defs.name: rerun_env
defs.docs:
Writes a line telling Cargo to rerun the build script if the environment
 variable `var` changes.

attributes.value: / Writes a line telling Cargo to rerun the build script if the environment
/ variable `var` changes.
/ This looks like: `cargo:rerun-if-env-changed=VAR`
/ This requires at least cargo 0.21.0, corresponding to rustc 1.20.0.  Earlier
/ versions of cargo will simply ignore the directive.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Create a new `AutoCfg` instance.

attributes.value: / Create a new `AutoCfg` instance.
/ # Panics
/ Panics if `AutoCfg::new()` returns an error.

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Create a new `AutoCfg` instance.

attributes.value: / Create a new `AutoCfg` instance.
/ # Common errors
/ - `rustc` can't be executed, from `RUSTC` or in the `PATH`.
/ - The version output from `rustc` can't be parsed.
/ - `OUT_DIR` is not set in the environment, or is not a writable directory.

defs.name: with_dir
defs.value: pub fn with_dir<T: Into<PathBuf>>(T) -> Result<Self, Error>
defs.docs: Create a new `AutoCfg` instance with the specified output directory.

attributes.value: / Create a new `AutoCfg` instance with the specified output directory.
/ # Common errors
/ - `rustc` can't be executed, from `RUSTC` or in the `PATH`.
/ - The version output from `rustc` can't be parsed.
/ - `dir` is not a writable directory.

defs.name: probe_rustc_version
defs.value: pub fn probe_rustc_version(&Self, usize, usize) -> bool
defs.docs:
Test whether the current `rustc` reports a version greater than
 or equal to "`major`.`minor`".

attributes.value: / Test whether the current `rustc` reports a version greater than
/ or equal to "`major`.`minor`".

defs.name: emit_rustc_version
defs.docs:
Sets a `cfg` value of the form `rustc_major_minor`, like `rustc_1_29`,
 if the current `rustc` is at least that version.

attributes.value: / Sets a `cfg` value of the form `rustc_major_minor`, like `rustc_1_29`,
/ if the current `rustc` is at least that version.

defs.name: probe_sysroot_crate
defs.docs: Tests whether the given sysroot crate can be used.

attributes.value: / Tests whether the given sysroot crate can be used.
/ The test code is subject to change, but currently looks like:
/ ```ignore
/ extern crate CRATE as probe;

defs.name: emit_sysroot_crate
defs.docs: Emits a config value `has_CRATE` if `probe_sysroot_crate` returns true.

attributes.value: / Emits a config value `has_CRATE` if `probe_sysroot_crate` returns true.

defs.name: probe_path
defs.docs: Tests whether the given path can be used.

attributes.value: / Tests whether the given path can be used.
/ The test code is subject to change, but currently looks like:
/ ```ignore
/ pub use PATH;

defs.name: emit_has_path
defs.docs: Emits a config value `has_PATH` if `probe_path` returns true.

attributes.value: / Emits a config value `has_PATH` if `probe_path` returns true.
/ Any non-identifier characters in the `path` will be replaced with
/ `_` in the generated config value.

defs.name: emit_path_cfg
defs.docs: Emits the given `cfg` value if `probe_path` returns true.

attributes.value: / Emits the given `cfg` value if `probe_path` returns true.

defs.docs: Tests whether the given trait can be used.

attributes.value: / Tests whether the given trait can be used.
/ The test code is subject to change, but currently looks like:
/ ```ignore
/ pub trait Probe: TRAIT + Sized {}
